channel.title: Getting Started on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] How to learn newbies before they get into Bayesian statistics
item.description: # Purpose of this article and target audience This article provides a guide to those who have barely studied statistics before being able to speak brilliantly about Young’s statistics in the now known Bayesian stats. The goal of this article is to be able to tell correct things about Bayesian statistics with a doya face, and to be able to argue with people who are familiar with statistics. Please note that studying this article will not make you familiar with Bayesian statistics.

item.title: [Python] I implemented a blockchain that actually moves in about 170 lines
item.description: This article is day 6 of [Blockchain Advent Calendar 2019](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/blockchain).Yesterdaywas@y-chan's[Understandingatomicswap](https://qiita.com/y-chan/items/f69b628f65ce12097e4a). Occurrence of things “There are a lot of blockchain commentary books out there, but I’m not sure how it will end up.” “Structural blockchain seems easy, but I don’t really understand how to make the contents of the block or the mechanism of mining.” I thought “If you don’t understand the explanation, it’s a programmer who should implement it by Mumu.
